interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Authentication.TLSCertificate.DRAFT
interface.tp:docstring: This object represents a TLS certificate.

tp:simple-type.name: Certificate_Data
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: The raw data contained in a TLS certificate.

tp:enum.name: TLS_Certificate_State
tp:enum.tp:docstring: The possible states for a TLSCertificate.DRAFT object.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The certificate has no state associated with it.

tp:enum.name: TLS_Certificate_Reject_Reason
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Possible reasons to reject a TLS certificate.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The certificate has been rejected for another reason not listed in this enumeration.
The certificate is not active yet.
The hostname certified does not match the provided one.
The certificate uses an insecure cipher algorithm.

property.name: State
property.tp:docstring: The current state of this certificate. State change notifications happen by means of the StateChanged signal.

property.name: RejectReason
property.tp:docstring: The reason why this certificate has been rejected.

property.name: CertificateType
property.tp:docstring:
The type of this TLS certificate (e.g. 'x509' or 'pgp').
This property is immutable

property.name: CertificateChainData
property.tp:docstring:
The RAW PEM-encoded trust chain of this TLS certificate.
This property is immutable.

signal.name: StateChanged
signal.tp:docstring: The state of this TLS certificate has changed.

arg.name: State
arg.tp:docstring: The new state of the TLS certificate.

arg.name: Reason
arg.tp:docstring: The reason why the state of the TLS certificate changed.

method.name: Accept
method.tp:docstring: Accepts this certificate, i.e. marks it as verified.

arg.name: Reason
arg.tp:docstring: The reason why this certificate is being rejected.
